meanings.definition: Make the best or most effective use of (a situation, opportunity, or resource).
meanings.sent1: I always try to optimize my study time by creating a schedule and sticking to it.
meanings.sent2: It is important to optimize your budget to ensure you can save money for the future.
meanings.sent3: Trying to optimize my morning routine by setting multiple alarms was a hilarious disaster.
meanings.sent4: She managed to optimize her small apartment by cleverly using space-saving furniture.
meanings.sent5: The coach's advice on how to optimize our performance during the game was incredibly helpful.

meanings.definition: Modify (a system) to make it as fully functional or effective as possible.
meanings.sent1: The IT team worked hard to optimize the company's network for faster data transfer.
meanings.sent2: Engineers constantly optimize the design of the car to improve fuel efficiency.
meanings.sent3: Attempting to optimize the coffee machine to also make pancakes was a comical failure.
meanings.sent4: The artist used various techniques to optimize the colors in the painting for a more vibrant look.
meanings.sent5: The chef's goal was to optimize the kitchen layout for maximum efficiency during busy hours.
